description: <p>This post will be supporting CSU, CCG and GP Practice staff across our CSU area, including the Clinical COVID-19 Assessment Service across England. You will be base in Bridgwater, you will be based with other IT Services staff that provide Server, Project and Training elements of our Service.  We are looking for an enthusiastic & motivated individual with a positive and customer focused approach. The successful candidate will be instrumental in delivering high quality IT Support services to our customers on our Service Desks, by taking calls from customers on the phone, answering Self-Service Portal raised tickets, chat messaging etc.   You will need to record accurate information about the user, their fault and other key information to aid the issue/fault being fixed.   Aiming to complete a level of First Fix’s (resolving customer’s faults at first point of contact) where possible and working with 2nd Line to ensure the customer’s expectations are met.  Key Responsibilities also include, ensuring that standardised methods and procedures are used for efficient handling and reporting of incidents.  Increasing the visibility and communication of incidents to business and IT staff and enhancing business perception of IT through use of professional approaches in quickly resolving and communicating incidents.  The Service Desk operates 7 days a week between 08:00 and 20:00, you will be part of a shift pattern (working 7.5 hours per day) to cover these hours.  The regular working week will total 37.5 hours: working 7.5 hours per day, 5 days per week. To meet the business requirements of SCW, once approx. every 3.5 weeks you will be required to work 6 days of the week, 7.5 hours a day: totalling 45 hours of paid work. The weekend rate will be paid at the Agenda for change rates.</p>
